intro: Chaetanthera ciliata, commonly known as the silky sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, which give it its common name. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
